metadata.title: CVE-2021-39242 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in HAProxy 2.2 before 2.2.16, 2.3 before 2.3.13,and 2.4 before 2.4.3. It can lead to a situation with anattacker-controlled HTTP Host header, because a mismatch between Host andauthority is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu1
vim-haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-2ubuntu1').
